name: "Let There Be Light"-Episode 9 of "SAJV" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to her gravestone, what year does Saratoga Browne die?
questions.explanation:
1861.

	The episode opens with Phileas staring at her gravestone--he is, to quote Jules Verne, "moping around in a suicidal fashion."

questions.text: Complete this quote from Rebecca: "He's going to get himself killed before we get to _______."
questions.explanation:
Baltimore.

	On the train on their way to Baltimore, Phileas plays it just a bit dangerously. He takes offense at the slightest thing, and wants to duel with a man for an insignificant reason.

questions.text: On the train, Al, a young newsboy, tries to sell all kinds of things to Jules, Rebecca, and Passepartout. Who wrote the newspaper he sells them?
questions.explanation:
Al himself.

	Jules falls asleep when Rebecca reads it to him.

questions.text: Rebecca reads in a newspaper (not the one Al sells her!)about a girl who was deaf from birth. A doctor operated on her and restored her hearing. Who is she with when she reads about this?
questions.explanation:
Sir Jonathan Chatsworth.

	Rebecca realizes that this surgeon may be able to help Al, who also has a hearing problem. She also realizes that this may help Phileas to take his mind off his grief. She is so happy that she gives Sir Jonathan a kiss on the cheek!

questions.text: When Rebecca tells Phileas about the doctor who could help Al, what is he doing?
questions.explanation:
Shaving.

	Rebecca: "It is time you started thinking about someone else besides yourself."  Jules: "We're tired of you moping around in this suicidal fashion, Fogg."

questions.text: What is special about Rebecca's hoopskirt?
options: Nothing much. . . except that she looks pretty hot in it.
When arranged in a certain shape, it's a portal that she can use to travel through time.
questions.explanation:
It's also a ladder.

	Rebecca uses this magical item of clothing to climb up a building, inside which is hidden a machine that Al has build. It's a weapon of mass destruction, and Mr. Thrubworth intends to use it to beat the Confederate Army in the war.

questions.text: When the gang is captured and put in a cargo car on a train, what does Rebecca throw at the guards that knocks them out?
questions.explanation:
A ring.

	Her ring explodes with poisonous gas when she throws it at them, completely knocking them out.

questions.text: During the battle at the end, who accompanies Phileas when he goes to rescue Al?
questions.explanation:
Jules.

	Mr. Thrubworth and Al are inside the machine, and Phileas realizes that Al could get killed if he stays there much longer.

questions.text: Yes, another Rebecca's wardrobe question! Does Rebecca wear the famous catsuit in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	She was wearing it when she climbed up the hoop-skirt ladder, and wore it to the end of the episode, as well as some of the next one.

Thomas Edison.

	"Al" was short for his middle name, Alva. Hope you enjoyed playing my quiz, and please rate it! :) P.S. If you would like to see a really awesome "SAJV" photo gallery, check out the Two Evil Monks' guide to the "Secret Adventures of Jules Verne" at www.twoevilmonks.org.
